meanings.definition: Exhausted from physical or mental exertion.
meanings.sent1: After a long day of hiking, I felt outwearied and ready for bed.
meanings.sent2: The outwearied runner collapsed at the finish line, completely drained of energy.
meanings.sent3: The outwearied puppy fell asleep mid-play, too tired to continue.
meanings.sent4: Her outwearied mind struggled to focus on the complex math problem.
meanings.sent5: The outwearied soldier trudged through the muddy battlefield, longing for rest.

meanings.definition: To tire out or wear out through excessive use or strain.
meanings.sent1: The constant use of the old treadmill eventually outwearied its motor.
meanings.sent2: She outwearied herself trying to meet all the deadlines at work.
meanings.sent3: The children's endless questions outwearied the teacher, but she answered each one patiently.
meanings.sent4: The harsh weather conditions outwearied the fabric of the tent, causing it to tear.
meanings.sent5: His demanding schedule outwearied him, leaving him no time for relaxation.
